List of members includes international telecoms companies and national administrations. About a quarter of members are Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) or micro-enterprises and 15% are research bodies or universities. User organizations also play a key role in ETSI in ensuring that our standards meet the needs of consumers.
fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Education and training, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Transport
eu_initiatives:
EU policy on European Standardization as defined in EU Regulation 1025/2012. 
 
ETSI is one of the 3 standards organizations recognized by EU. It is funded at 82% by members contribution and receives funding from the European Commission.  
ETSI is specifically active in the scope of the ICT-RP (Rolling Plan) as well  as in specific areas such as the RED (Radio equipment Directive), cybersecurity, mobile payments, IoT, interoperability.  
 
ETSI works closely with the European Commission (standards in support of policy/legislation and regulation) 
ETSI has interaction with policy makers (EC/EP/Council) on all those files.
